A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
There's not much I can say about a new\, numbered Star Wars release that won't already have been said\, especially with the backlash occurring sooner and sooner post-release. But I will say this: I both love the film\, and have a few problems with it.

There are some dangling threads JJ introduced which go largely unresolved or cast aside with a one liner\, and that is a bit of a disappointment. In particular\, I wish we'd gotten to see at least one OP Luke scene\, akin to THAT sequence of Darth Vader from Rogue One. I'm also deeply curious as to what Episode 9 will be about\, given how conclusive this film felt.

But the thing about Last Jedi is that it's an incredible FILM - the characters are fleshed out for the most part\, the dialogue is great\, the effects phenomenal\, the photography direction impeccable. This is pop art at its finest and I refuse to let plot elements which didn't go the way I would have directed them sour me on what is\, for the most part\, a masterpiece. I do think I prefer The Force Awakens\, but only slightly.
